result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Billy J Ferree

records.addlTxt:
10:23 AM Defendant Billy J Ferree in court.  Attorney J Andrew Herbers Jr. in court for Billy J Ferree.  Attorney Melissa Zilavy in court for State of Wisconsin. 

Attorney Herbers states they have a resolution and request a date for plea and sentencing.  Court sets matter for plea and sentencing date.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for November 10, 2022 at 02:30 pm.
Plea/sentencing hearing on November 10, 2022 at 02:30 pm.

1:38 PM  Attorney J Andrew Herbers Jr. in court for Billy J Ferree.  Defendant Billy J Ferree in Court.  District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin by Julian Maruffo.  

Attorney Herbers requests a new date stating there is up front restitution that needs to be paid and states this matter should not have been put on the pre-trial calendar due to there being a victim.
Court adjourns and will set this matter for further proceedings before the assigned Judge.  
Hearing scheduled for October 20, 2022 at 10:30 am.
Effective August 1, 2022, this case is assigned to Branch 7 Judicial Vacancy, pursuant to 22-SO-04(67).

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt: Appointing Atty. Herbers as counsel of record for the defendant.
Pre-trial conference on September 30, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed.  Defendant not to possess any drug paraphernalia.  Defendant to have no contact with witnesses/business listed in the Criminal Complaint/Victim Identification Key.  Defendant is not to share, reproduce or distribute any personal and/or identifying information about the crime victim(s), except to their attorney.

10:07 AM Defendant Billy J Ferree in court with attorney  State Public Defender Law Intern.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant is eligible for State Public Defender representation.  An attorney will be appointed.  Defense acknowledges receipt of complaint and waives reading of complaint.  Service admitted/advised of charges and potential penalties.  NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for September 30, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Victim/Witness Identification Key filed, under seal,  by the District Attorney's office.
